annotation.summary: A 4th-level enchantment spell that allows the caster to influence a target's behavior with a compelling suggestion.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells or access to the Suggestion spell.

annotation.summary: A ranged ability affecting one creature within 30 feet, resisted by the target's Will defense, with a duration that can change depending on context.
On a critical success, the target resists the spell completely and becomes aware of the attempted control.
annotation.action_economy: None (result of a saving throw, not an action)
annotation.prerequisites: Occurs when a creature critically succeeds on its saving throw against a control spell.

annotation.summary: On a failed saving throw, the target obeys the caster’s suggestion for up to one minute or until the task is completed or becomes clearly harmful.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell casting time (typically 1 action)
annotation.prerequisites: Target must have failed its saving throw against the suggestion spell

annotation.summary: A critical failure results in the same outcome as a normal failure, but the effect lasts for 1 hour instead of the usual duration.
A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon an animal creature to aid them in combat or other tasks.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that calls forth a celestial creature to aid the caster in battle or perform tasks for a limited duration.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level divine or primal spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon a construct creature to fight or perform tasks on their behalf.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that allows the caster to summon a dragon creature to aid them in battle or perform tasks.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A spell that allows the caster to summon an elemental creature to fight or perform tasks. It requires the expenditure of three actions to cast and is available as a 2nd-level spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that allows the caster to summon an entity using three actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon a fey creature to aid them in combat or perform tasks.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that allows the caster to summon a fiendish creature to fight or serve them.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A game effect with a range of 30 feet that can be sustained for up to 1 minute.
annotation.action_economy: Requires sustaining actions to maintain effect each round.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified.

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that allows the caster to summon a giant creature to fight or assist them.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: The spell creates a temporary handheld musical instrument that only the caster can play. The instrument disappears when the spell ends or if the caster summons another instrument using the same spell.
annotation.action_economy: Cast Spell (varies by system, typically 1 action)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the 'summon instrument' spell

annotation.summary: A 5th-level spell that summons a monitor creature using three actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon a plant or fungus creature to aid them in battle or perform tasks.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon a robotic creature using three actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that allows the caster to summon an undead creature to fight or act on their behalf, using three actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level necromancy spells

annotation.summary: A first-level spell that enhances a weapon's next attack to deal extra damage when cast using two actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: The effect can target a single weapon held by you or a willing ally within 30 feet, lasting for up to one minute or until the effect is used or discharged.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be holding a weapon or have a willing ally holding one within 30 feet

annotation.summary: Sure Footing is a 2nd-level spell that requires two actions to cast, likely enhancing stability or balance for the target.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: Removes or temporarily suppresses conditions that restrict a target's movement by attempting a counteract check against effects causing clumsy, grabbed, or paralyzed.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (depends on spell or ability context)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform a counteract check; target must be affected by clumsy, grabbed, or paralyzed.

annotation.summary: The spell is ineffective against curses, diseases, or conditions that are inherent to the target's natural state.
Sure Strike is a first-level spell that can be cast using one action, likely enhancing the accuracy or reliability of an attack roll.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: Synaptic Pulse is a 5th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely involves a burst of mental energy affecting nearby creatures' minds.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A magical effect from the occult tradition that creates a 30-foot emanation influencing creatures within it for 1 round, resisted by a Will defense.
When the spell is heightened to 2nd level, its duration extends to 8 hours.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be cast using a 2nd-level or higher spell slot.

annotation.summary: The ability or action is classified as uncommon and involves both concentration and manipulation components.
annotation.prerequisites: None indicated

annotation.summary: A spell or ability that requires the caster to touch a single corpse, targeting its Will defense, and lasts for 10 minutes.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to touch the target corpse

annotation.summary: Animates a mostly intact corpse to answer up to three questions using its residual physical memories, not its spirit. The corpse must have a functional mouth and throat, and prior casting within a week causes automatic failure. The corpse can resist with a Will save using its original statistics.
prerequisites: corpse must have a mouth and throat
no previous casting on the same corpse within one week

annotation.summary: On a failed saving throw, the affected creature must answer truthfully but may respond in vague, repetitive, or evasive ways to waste time until the spell ends.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; describes outcome on failure rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Applies when a creature fails its saving throw against the spell.

annotation.summary: The caster conjures a magical vine that lashes out toward a target, requiring a spell attack roll to determine if it hits.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells or access to a spell attack roll

annotation.summary: On a critical success, the target becomes immobilized and suffers a 10-foot reduction to all its Speeds for 1 round. The target can attempt an Escape check against your spell DC to end these effects early.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a spell or ability that can critically succeed against a target

annotation.summary: On a successful effect, the target’s movement speed is reduced by 10 feet for one round, but it can attempt an Escape check against the caster’s spell DC to end the penalty early.
annotation.action_economy: None specified; effect occurs upon success resolution.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires a successful application of the spell or ability that imposes this effect.

annotation.summary: Creates a magical hand that lifts and moves an object up to 20 feet, and can continue moving it with sustained effort. The object falls if the spell ends while airborne.
annotation.action_economy: Cast: 2 actions; Sustain: 1 action to move the object again
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; target must be a loose object within range

annotation.summary: Telekinetic Haul is a 5th-level spell that allows the caster to move or lift objects at a distance using telekinetic force, typically enabling the manipulation of much heavier or larger items than lower-level telekinesis effects.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: The effect allows you to move a target up to 20 feet, even suspending it in midair. Each time you Sustain the spell, you can either continue moving the same target or switch to another valid target within range.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a Sustain action to continue or redirect the effect.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have an active telekinetic spell and a valid target within range.

annotation.summary: Telekinetic Maneuver is a 2nd-level spell that allows the caster to manipulate a creature or object at a distance using telekinetic force, typically to perform a combat maneuver such as trip, shove, or disarm.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: You use telekinetic force to manipulate an enemy or their belongings, substituting a spell attack roll for the usual Athletics check when performing certain combat maneuvers.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to make a spell attack; target within range of telekinetic effect

annotation.summary: The caster magically throws a small unattended object at a target within range, making a spell attack roll to determine if it hits.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (depending on casting time, typically 2 actions for a standard spell)
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the ability to cast the spell and an unattended object of 1 Bulk or less within range

annotation.summary: Telekinetic Strangulation is a 6th-level spell that uses telekinetic force to choke or restrain a target from a distance.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells or access to the Telekinetic Strangulation spell.

annotation.summary: The effect provides a defensive benefit determined by AC and lasts as long as it is sustained, up to one minute.
annotation.action_economy: requires sustaining each round to maintain effect
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: A telekinetic spell that lifts and chokes a creature, dealing heavy bludgeoning damage and immobilizing it. The target must hold its breath or begin suffocating, and sustaining the spell continues to damage and restrain the target. The target can attempt to Escape using your spell DC.
Telekinetic Tantrum is a 9th-level spell that requires three actions to cast, likely involving a powerful burst of telekinetic energy that manipulates or damages objects and creatures in the area.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 9th-level spells

annotation.summary: The effect has a defense component described elsewhere and can be maintained for up to one minute if sustained.
annotation.action_economy: Requires sustaining each round to maintain the effect, up to 1 minute total.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated; refer to the referenced defense text for details.

annotation.summary: A spell that unleashes psychokinetic energy to damage creatures or move objects. Each time it is cast or sustained for the first time in a round, the caster selects one of several effects, but cannot repeat the same effect consecutively.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a Spell; Sustain a Spell (once per round for additional effects)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the specified psychokinetic spell

annotation.summary: The caster telekinetically hurls multiple creatures or objects within range, moving them up to 40 feet in any direction. Each target can weigh up to 40 Bulk. Hurled creatures take bludgeoning damage as if from a fall and land prone unless they succeed on a Fortitude save, which prevents movement.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (typically a spell casting action)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell 'Back Off!' or equivalent telekinetic power

annotation.summary: A psychokinetic storm strikes all creatures in an area with a ranged spell attack, dealing force damage and briefly stunning those hit.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast psychokinetic or similar spells

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that involves concentration, manipulation, and teleportation effects.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; typically performed as a manipulate action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to uncommon abilities or spells with teleportation traits.

annotation.summary: The spell instantly transports you and chosen targets to a precisely identified location within range. Accurate knowledge of the destination is required; errors can cause failure or unintended results. Over long distances, arrival may deviate by about 1% of the total distance traveled.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action (typical casting time for teleportation spells)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the teleportation spell and precise knowledge of the target location’s position and appearance.

annotation.summary: Temporal Bullets is a 2nd-level spell that can be cast as a reaction, likely involving manipulation of time in conjunction with ranged attacks or ammunition.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: Thunderstrike is a first-level spell that requires two actions to cast, likely dealing thunder or sonic damage to targets within range.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 1st-level spells

annotation.summary: A spell that summons a lightning tendril to strike a target, dealing electricity and sonic damage with a basic Reflex save. Metal targets have a penalty to the save and may become clumsy if damaged.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (casting time not specified)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; target within range

annotation.summary: Time's Edge is a 3rd-level spell that requires two actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 3rd-level spells

annotation.summary: Toxic Cloud is a 5th-level spell that creates a poisonous cloud, likely dealing persistent poison damage or obscuring vision within an area.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A defensive ability that relies on Fortitude and lasts for one minute.

Creates a poisonous fog similar to a mist that drifts 10 feet away each round, dealing 6d8 poison damage to creatures starting their turn inside unless they succeed at a Fortitude save. The caster can dismiss the effect.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; access to the mist spell or similar effect

annotation.summary: When the spell is cast, the target gains the ability to understand one language it is currently hearing or reading, though it cannot decipher codes or figurative language. If multiple languages are present, the target or GM determines which one is understood.
annotation.prerequisites: Target must be able to hear or read a language at the time of casting

annotation.summary: A 4th-level spell that allows the caster to instantly move themselves or another target from one location to another.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: The effect allows the user to instantly teleport themselves and their carried or worn items to a visible, unoccupied space within range. The effect fails if it would transport another creature, even indirectly.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to see the destination space and have the effect available for use

annotation.summary: True Target is a 7th-level spell that can be cast with one action, typically enhancing an ally's accuracy or granting advantage on attacks against a chosen foe.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 7th-level spells

annotation.summary: The effect lasts until the beginning of your next turn, after which it ends automatically.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: The caster grants allies insight into a designated creature’s possible evasive actions, allowing each affected ally to roll twice and take the better result on their first attack against that creature, ignoring concealment and circumstance penalties.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the 'true target' spell or equivalent divination magic

annotation.summary: You can perceive the true nature of things within 60 feet. The GM secretly rolls a counteract check against illusion, morph, or polymorph effects to determine if you see through them, revealing true forms without dispelling the effects.
annotation.prerequisites: ability or effect that grants true sight or similar perception

annotation.summary: Truespeech is a 5th-level spell that requires two actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: The ability or action is classified as uncommon and involves both concentration and manipulation components.
When the spell is heightened to 7th level, its duration increases to 8 hours.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be cast using a 7th-level spell slot or higher.

annotation.summary: A powerful 8th-level spell that forces a target to dance uncontrollably, impairing their ability to act effectively in combat.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 8th-level spells

annotation.summary: A magical effect associated with the arcane and occult traditions that targets one creature within touch range, requiring a Will defense check, and has a variable duration.
The spell compels the target to dance uncontrollably, leaving them off-guard for its duration.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (varies by casting time)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast enchantment spells or access to the spell list containing this effect

annotation.summary: On a successful casting, the spell lasts for 3 rounds and imposes an effect on the target that continues for the duration.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell (typically 1 action to cast)
annotation.prerequisites: Must successfully cast the spell and have a valid target

annotation.summary: On a failed casting, the spell lasts 1 minute and forces the target to use at least two actions per turn to dance.
annotation.action_economy: Target must spend at least 2 actions each turn dancing.
annotation.prerequisites: Failure result of the spell casting.

annotation.summary: On a critical failure, the spell lasts 1 minute and forces the target to use all its actions each turn to dance.
annotation.action_economy: Target spends all actions each turn dancing for 1 minute.
annotation.prerequisites: Occurs only on a critical failure when casting the spell.

annotation.summary: A 4th-level spell named Unfettered Movement that requires two actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: This spell allows the target to ignore circumstance penalties to Speed and automatically succeed at Escape attempts against non-magical or lower-rank magical effects that immobilize, grab, or restrain them.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by casting time of the spell (typically 2 actions for most spells).
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the 'unfettered movement' spell or access to equivalent magical effects.

annotation.summary: Unfettered Pack is a 7th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely enhances the mobility or freedom of movement for multiple allies, removing restrictions or impediments that hinder their movement.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 7th-level spells

annotation.summary: A 6th-level spell that drains life force from nearby creatures, harming them and restoring vitality to the caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells

annotation.summary: The caster gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt to the creature that took the most damage from the spell, lasting up to one minute.
annotation.action_economy: None (effect occurs as part of the spell resolution)
annotation.prerequisites: Must cast a spell that deals damage to at least one creature

annotation.summary: A third-level spell that requires two actions to cast, likely involving draining life or vitality from a target to heal the caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 3rd-level spells

annotation.summary: Vapor Form is a 4th-level spell that transforms the caster into a misty or gaseous state, allowing movement through small openings and granting resistance to physical damage while limiting offensive actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: The target becomes a vaporous, amorphous form with reduced physical vulnerability and limited capabilities. It loses armor benefits, gains resistance to physical damage, immunity to precision damage, and can fly slowly or pass through small openings. Offensive and manipulative actions are restricted, but the effect can be dismissed voluntarily.
annotation.prerequisites: Target must be affected by the spell or effect that causes the vaporous transformation.

annotation.summary: The ability or action is classified as uncommon and involves both concentration and manipulation components.

Creates magical wards around a target to block or counteract detection, revelation, and scrying spells for the duration, treating cantrips as 1st-rank spells. If it counters a multi-target or area spell, only the protected target is unaffected.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (typically Cast a Spell)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast abjuration spells or access to the Veil of Privacy spell

annotation.summary: Verdant Code is a level 2 spell that requires two actions to cast. The paragraph only provides the spell name, level, and action cost, without additional descriptive text.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified

annotation.summary: A defensive ability that relies on a Reflex-based defense and lasts for one minute.

Causes plants to erupt from an unattended technological object, creating a 20-foot burst area that damages and may immobilize creatures starting their turn within it. The growth also obscures the object, making it harder to access.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (likely a spell casting action)
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an unattended technological object as the target

annotation.summary: Vibe Check is a 2nd-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The paragraph only provides the spell name, level, and action cost without further description.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: A single creature within 60 feet must resist a Will defense; the effect lasts for 1 round.

Spells with the summon trait create creatures, usually of a specific type, that appear in an unoccupied space within range. The summoned creature must be common, gains the summoned trait, and its maximum level depends on the spell’s rank. These rules apply only to spells with the summon trait; other conjuration spells follow their own descriptions.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically requires the standard casting time for the spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to cast a spell with the summon trait and have access to the appropriate creature entry.

annotation.summary: A table showing the maximum creature level that can be affected or summoned by a spell, depending on the spell's rank.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this is a reference table, not an action description.
annotation.prerequisites: Knowledge of spell ranks and how they relate to creature levels in the game system.

annotation.summary: The spell's effect changes depending on the chosen emotion; selecting anger or joy adds the incapacitation trait to the spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Must choose an emotion; anger or joy specifically trigger the incapacitation trait.

annotation.summary: When heightened to 4th level, the spell targets all creatures within a 20-foot burst, applying a single chosen emotion effect to each creature.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be heightened to 4th level

annotation.summary: Vibrant Pattern is a 6th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely creates a dazzling display of colors or light to affect creatures' senses or perception.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells

annotation.summary: A defensive effect that targets Will and can be maintained for up to one minute through sustained effort.
annotation.action_economy: requires sustain action each round to maintain
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: A creature that fails the saving throw becomes blinded by the pattern. It can make a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns after leaving the pattern to end the blinded condition, which lasts up to 1 minute.
annotation.action_economy: Saving throw at the end of each turn (no action required)
annotation.prerequisites: Creature must have failed the initial saving throw against the pattern effect

annotation.summary: Vision of Death is a 4th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The spell likely inflicts fear or death-related effects on a target, invoking terrifying visions or necrotic energy.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: The caster projects a deadly illusion causing the target to witness its own death, dealing 8d6 mental damage with a Will saving throw. If this damage reduces the target to 0 HP, the illusion manifests and kills the target outright.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast illusion or mental damage spells; target must be a creature capable of perceiving the illusion.

annotation.summary: The effect lasts until the character performs their next daily preparations.
Creates a healing aura that allows you or an ally to touch you once per round to regain decreasing amounts of Hit Points. The effect ends after four uses and only one beacon can be active at a time.
annotation.action_economy: Once per round, an Interact action by you or an ally to trigger healing.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the Vital Beacon spell.

annotation.summary: Void Scour is a 7th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The name suggests it manipulates or purges void or negative energy.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 7th-level spells

annotation.summary: Void Vessel is an 8th-level spell that requires three actions to cast, likely involving the creation or summoning of a vessel imbued with void or cosmic energy.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 8th-level spells

annotation.summary: A spell or ability that affects the caster and up to ten willing creatures within 30 feet for a duration of eight hours.
annotation.prerequisites: None stated

annotation.summary: Void Whispers is a 3rd-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The name suggests it involves communicating or invoking unsettling whispers from the void, likely causing mental or auditory effects.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 3rd-level spells

annotation.summary: A ranged ability affecting one creature within 30 feet that targets the creature's Will defense and has a variable duration.
annotation.prerequisites: none stated

annotation.summary: On a failed save, the affected creature spends each of its actions stepping in random directions for up to 1 minute, avoiding hazardous terrain. The effect ends early if any creature takes a hostile action against it.
annotation.action_economy: Uses each of its actions to Step in random directions.
annotation.prerequisites: Occurs when the target fails the saving throw against the spell.

annotation.summary: On a critical failure, the affected target babbles incoherently, forcing nearby creatures to make a Will save or move randomly and gain temporary immunity to the effect.
annotation.action_economy: Creatures that fail the Will save must use their first action on their next turn to Step in a random direction.
annotation.prerequisites: Occurs only on a critical failure result of the spell or effect that caused it.

annotation.summary: A powerful 9th-level spell named Wails of the Damned that requires two actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 9th-level spells

annotation.summary: Creates a blazing wall of fire that deals damage to creatures passing through or near it.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: The ability or spell has a range of 120 feet and lasts for 1 minute.
Creates an invisible, indestructible wall of magical force that blocks physical and magical effects.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells

annotation.summary: Describes the properties of a magical force wall, including its durability, immunities, and what can or cannot pass through it.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires casting of the specific spell that creates the wall

annotation.summary: A Wall of Force cannot be counteracted by effects of equal or lower rank, but it is instantly destroyed if targeted by a Disintegrate spell of any rank.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast Wall of Force or Disintegrate

annotation.summary: Creates a barrier or dome of solid ice that can block movement and line of effect, and can be broken or melted.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: Creates an opaque wall or dome of ice that blocks vision and can freeze enemies when broken. The caster chooses either a straight wall up to 60 feet long and 10 feet high or a hemispherical dome with a 10-foot radius, both 1 foot thick. The structure must be anchored to solid surfaces and cannot intersect creatures or objects.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action (casting time implied by spell use)
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an open space with solid surfaces for anchoring; cannot intersect creatures or objects.

annotation.summary: Wall of Plasma is a 6th-level spell that requires three actions to cast, likely creating a barrier of superheated energy that damages or blocks passage.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells

annotation.summary: Wall of Steel is a 7th-level spell that requires three actions to cast, likely creating a durable barrier of metal for defense or battlefield control.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 7th-level spells

annotation.summary: A game effect with a range of 120 feet that lasts for 1 minute.

Creates a 4-inch-thick wall of steel up to 120 feet long and 20 feet high, which can be shaped along borders between squares and oriented in various ways such as vertically, horizontally, or as stairs or a bridge. The wall must be placed in open space without intersecting creatures or objects, or the effect fails.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action or casting time as defined by the spell
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an open, unobstructed area for placement; cannot intersect creatures or objects

annotation.summary: A fifth-level spell that creates a durable wall of stone, typically used for defense, battlefield control, or shaping terrain.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: Creates a solid stone wall up to 120 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 inch thick. The caster can shape its path and orientation, forming structures like bridges or stairs, but it must be placed in an open space without intersecting creatures or objects.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action or casting time as defined by the spell
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell; requires an open, unobstructed area for placement

annotation.summary: Creates a thick barrier of thorny vegetation that obstructs movement and damages creatures passing through it.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 3rd-level spells

annotation.summary: Creates a vertical wall of thorny brambles up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides cover, counts as difficult terrain, and damages creatures that move through it.
annotation.action_economy: 1 action to cast; movement through the wall triggers damage per move action used.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires an open, unobstructed space; wall cannot intersect creatures or objects.

annotation.summary: Creates a barrier of strong wind that blocks movement, projectiles, or gases depending on the game's rules for wind effects.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 3rd-level spells

annotation.summary: Physical ranged ammunition cannot pass through the wall. Larger thrown or ranged weapons suffer a –2 circumstance penalty when their attack path crosses the wall. Massive ranged weapons and non-physical spell effects are unaffected.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this describes an environmental or barrier effect rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: A wall or barrier effect that interacts with ranged attacks must be present.

annotation.summary: The spell confuses a creature's mind, forcing a Will saving throw. After the effect, the target becomes temporarily immune for 10 minutes. The effect occurs instantly and cannot be counteracted by typical dispel abilities, though powerful magic like wish or abilities that remove non-magical effects can undo it.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (varies by casting time, not specified)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell or use a similar mental effect

annotation.summary: When the spell is heightened to 3rd level, its duration increases to 8 hours.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be cast at 3rd level or higher.

annotation.summary: When heightened to 4th level, the effect lasts until your next daily preparations.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be heightened to 4th level.

annotation.summary: A 2nd-level spell that allows the caster and chosen creatures to move across the surface of water or similar liquids as though it were solid ground.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 2nd-level spells

annotation.summary: The spell allows the target to move across the surface of liquids as if they were solid ground, though it can submerge and swim normally if desired. It does not provide underwater breathing.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by system; typically cast as a standard or action-based spell.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires the ability to cast the spell and a valid target within range.

annotation.summary: When heightened to 4th level, the spell gains a 30-foot range, lasts for 1 hour, and can affect up to 10 creatures.
annotation.prerequisites: Spell must be heightened to 4th level

annotation.summary: Wave of Despair is a 5th-level spell that requires two actions to cast, likely creating an area-of-effect that inflicts emotional or mental penalties on affected creatures.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: A defensive ability that relies on a Will-based defense and lasts for one or more rounds.
On a failed check, the effect still occurs as if successful, but it only lasts for 1 minute.
Wave of Warning is a 5th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The details of its effects are not provided in the excerpt.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 5th-level spells

annotation.summary: Weight of Ages is a 4th-level spell that requires two actions to cast. The name suggests it imposes the burden or effects of great age upon a target, likely slowing or weakening them.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 4th-level spells

annotation.summary: A ranged magical effect that targets one creature's Will defense and lasts for one minute.
annotation.prerequisites: None stated

annotation.summary: A defensive effect that uses a Will defense and can be maintained for up to one minute with sustained effort.
annotation.action_economy: requires sustaining each round to maintain effect
annotation.prerequisites: none specified

annotation.summary: Summons a Tiny floating wisp of light that distracts a target, forcing a Will save or making them off-guard until your next turn. The wisp sheds bright light and can attempt the distraction each time you sustain the spell. Critical success grants temporary immunity.
annotation.action_economy: Cast the Spell; Sustain a Spell
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the *wisp ally* spell

annotation.summary: Each time the spell is heightened by one level, you create an additional wisp that targets a different creature. All wisps act simultaneously to distract their respective targets when the spell is cast or sustained.
annotation.action_economy: Occurs when casting or sustaining the spell
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to cast the base spell that creates wisps

annotation.summary: A 6th-level spell that grants the caster the ability to see through solid objects as though using x-ray vision.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level spells

annotation.summary: The ability or action is classified as uncommon and involves both concentration and manipulation components.
Mystics use their spiritual or psychic connection to manifest powerful magical effects known as revelations, which are represented by specific spells.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on the specific spell or revelation used.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must possess the Mystic class or equivalent ability to channel mystical energy.

annotation.summary: Akashic Fount is a level 1 focus spell that can be cast using a single action, likely drawing upon psychic or mental energy associated with akasha or knowledge.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Akashic Fount focus spell or a class feature that grants it.

annotation.summary: A special ability or action classified as uncommon, requiring focus and manipulation of mystic energies through concentration.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, typically taking one action in a turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or magical training; possession of a focus point or similar resource.

annotation.summary: Akashic Assistant is a 4th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely summons or manifests a mental or spiritual construct to aid the caster, drawing on akashic or psychic knowledge.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast focus spells; access to the Akashic or Psychic tradition.

annotation.summary: A special ability or action that is not commonly available, requiring focus and mystical manipulation to perform.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, typically performed as part of a standard action or activity.
annotation.prerequisites: Must possess a mystic or magical focus feature or equivalent ability.

annotation.summary: Summons an ethereal assistant from the Akashic Record that continuously uses the Aid action to help a chosen target, using the caster’s Occultism modifier for its rolls. The caster can use a free action with the concentrate trait to redirect the assistant to a new target.

action_economy.initial: Cast spell (varies by spell casting time)
action_economy.ongoing: Assistant uses its own reaction to Aid each round
action_economy.free_action: Redirect assistant to a new target (concentrate)

annotation.summary: A 6th-level focus spell named Data Drain that requires two actions to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level focus spells

annotation.summary: A special ability or action with uncommon rarity that requires focus and manipulation of mystical energies.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, typically taking one action in a turn.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or magical training; possession of a focus point or similar resource.

annotation.summary: A focus spell that imbues a weapon with elemental energy, enhancing its attacks with additional damage of a chosen elemental type.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Elemental Weapon focus spell, typically through a class or archetype that grants it.

annotation.summary: This entry lists the traits associated with a special ability or spell, indicating it is uncommon and involves concentration, focus, manipulation, and mystic elements.
annotation.action_economy: Requires focus and concentration, typically consuming an action related to manipulation or casting.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or focus-based abilities; may require specific training or class features.

annotation.summary: A spell allows a weapon with one fewer upgrade slot to temporarily integrate any held upgrades as a focus, granting extra 1d4 damage of a type determined by an elemental trait until the spell ends.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a spell (duration until spell ends)
annotation.prerequisites: Must be able to cast the spell and hold upgrades as a locus

annotation.summary: Creates a protective barrier of elemental energy using a two-action focus ability of level 4.
annotation.prerequisites: Focus Spell, Level 4

annotation.summary: An uncommon mystic ability or action that requires focus and involves a manipulate component.
annotation.prerequisites: access to mystic or focus-based abilities

annotation.summary: Creates a protective elemental barrier around a target, granting a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and allowing the target to use the Shield Block reaction as if wielding a raised shield. The caster chooses one elemental trait for the barrier: air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood.
annotation.action_economy: 1 or more actions (casting time not specified, but likely standard spell casting time)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell; must choose one elemental trait (air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood)

annotation.summary: A magical barrier with Hardness 6 and 40 HP grants Resistance 2 to a damage type determined by its elemental trait. It allows the user to use the spell’s reaction to block spells with the same elemental trait, unlike a normal Shield Block.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have cast the spell that creates the elemental barrier.

annotation.summary: Elemental Nova is a 6th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast, likely unleashing a burst of elemental energy in an area around the caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a class or archetype that grants the Elemental Nova focus spell and sufficient focus points.

annotation.summary: This entry lists the traits associated with a special ability or spell, indicating it is uncommon and involves concentration, focus, manipulation, and mystic elements.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; traits suggest it likely requires a focus or concentrate action.
annotation.prerequisites: None explicitly stated.

annotation.summary: An infusion ability that can be activated using between one and three actions and requires one Focus Point to use.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least 1 Focus Point available

annotation.summary: A special ability or action with uncommon rarity that involves focusing mystical vitality and manipulating void energies through concentration.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration or a focus action, likely a single action or focus point expenditure.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or void-themed abilities; must possess a focus pool or similar resource.

annotation.summary: A healing spell that restores a small amount of hit points to a willing creature and grants temporary immunity to further castings for 10 minutes. The spell's effects vary based on the number of actions used to cast it.
annotation.action_economy: Variable; the number of actions spent determines range, targets, and area.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; a willing target creature.

annotation.summary: This spell requires one action to cast and can only affect a target within touch range.
annotation.prerequisites: None

annotation.summary: A two-action spell that targets a creature within 30 feet and restores additional 6 Hit Points when used for healing.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell; target within 30 feet

annotation.summary: Vitality Nova is a focus spell or ability that requires two actions to activate and uses 4 Focus Points.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Focus abilities or a class feature granting Vitality Nova

annotation.summary: A special ability or action that is uncommon and involves focusing mystical vitality through concentration and manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration or a focus action, likely taking a single action or focus point expenditure.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or vitality-based abilities; must be able to perform concentrate and manipulate actions.

annotation.summary: When casting the spell in magical darkness and spending at least 20 Hit Points, the spell attempts to counteract the darkness effect.
annotation.prerequisites: Must spend 20 or more Hit Points and cast the spell in an area of magical darkness

annotation.summary: When at least 40 Hit Points are spent on the healing spell, affected creatures may attempt a DC 10 flat check to stop ongoing bleed damage.
annotation.action_economy: part of casting the healing spell
annotation.prerequisites: Spend 40 or more Hit Points when casting the spell

annotation.summary: When 60 or more Hit Points are spent through this spell, all ongoing damage effects on the healed creatures immediately end.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; effect occurs upon casting when HP threshold is met.
annotation.prerequisites: Must spend at least 60 Hit Points through the spell.

annotation.summary: Vital Rebirth is a 6th-level focus spell that can be used as a reaction, likely to restore vitality or prevent death.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level focus spells or access to the relevant class feature granting Vital Rebirth.

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that requires focus and manipulation of mystic vitality.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or vitality-based abilities

annotation.summary: When an allied creature would die, you intercept their departing soul and restore them to life, transferring vitality from your network to them. The revived ally cannot benefit from this effect again for 24 hours, and the spell fails against certain forms of death such as disintegration or promession. You must have at least 1 Hit Point in your vitality network to use this ability.
annotation.action_economy: reaction (triggered when an ally would die)
annotation.prerequisites: At least 1 Hit Point in your vitality network

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that involves focusing mystical and emotional energy through mental concentration and manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, typically performed mentally.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to uncommon or mystic abilities; must be able to perform focus or concentrate actions.

annotation.summary: Shuffle Repeat is a focus spell or ability that requires one action to perform and costs 4 Focus Points.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires at least 4 Focus Points available.

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with several traits indicating it is rare, involves mental and emotional focus, and requires concentration and mystical manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration or a focus action, depending on system context.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a mystic or mental ability; must be able to concentrate and manipulate emotional or mental energies.

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that involves mental and emotional focus, requiring concentration and mystical manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Varies; typically requires a focus or concentrate action.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to uncommon or mystic abilities; capacity for mental or emotional focus.

annotation.summary: Shadow Snap is a focus spell or ability that requires two actions to perform and uses one Focus Point, likely involving manipulating shadows to hinder or attack a target.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Focus Spells or a class feature granting Shadow Snap

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that requires concentration, focus, and physical or mystical manipulation, associated with shadow-themed or mystic powers.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, typically performed as part of casting or activating a mystic ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or shadow-themed powers; ability to perform concentrate and manipulate actions.

annotation.summary: The effect provides a defensive benefit determined by Armor Class (AC) and lasts as long as it is sustained, up to one minute.
annotation.action_economy: Requires sustaining each round to maintain the effect.
annotation.prerequisites: None specified.

annotation.summary: You command a target's shadow to attack or stalk it. If attacking, make a spell attack roll against the target's AC, dealing 1d10 cold damage on a hit or double on a critical hit. The attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell or effect that commands a shadow

annotation.summary: When you command the shadow to stalk, it readies an attack that triggers when the target performs certain actions, dealing cold damage and potentially disrupting the action on a critical hit.
annotation.action_economy: Reaction triggered by the target using a manipulate or move action, making a ranged attack, or leaving a square during movement.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have the ability to command the shadow.

annotation.summary: When you use the Sustain action on the spell, you may choose to have it either make an attack against the target or cause the shadow to follow the target until your next turn ends.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have an active spell that can be sustained

annotation.summary: Cloying Shadows is a 4th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely creates or manipulates shadows to hinder or obscure enemies, fitting a shadow or darkness-themed caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Cloying Shadows focus spell, typically through a class or archetype that grants shadow or darkness magic.

annotation.summary: A special mystic shadow ability that requires focus and deliberate manipulation, marked as uncommon.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action to perform.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or shadow-themed abilities; must be able to use focus actions.

annotation.summary: Shadow Prison is a 6th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely restrains or traps a target using shadowy energy, preventing movement or escape.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to 6th-level focus spells or a class feature granting Shadow-themed magic.

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with multiple traits indicating it is uncommon, requires concentration, involves emotional and mental components, and manipulates mystic or shadow energies. It may also incapacitate targets or focus the user's power.
annotation.action_economy: Likely requires a focus or concentrate action to activate.
annotation.prerequisites: User must have access to mystic or shadow abilities and the capacity to perform focus or mental actions.

annotation.summary: The caster manipulates the target's negative emotions, causing its shadow to consume it. The target must make a Will saving throw and becomes immune to the spell for 1 minute afterward.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast spells; target must have a shadow or emotions to affect

annotation.summary: On a successful save, the target avoids being fully engulfed but is partially restrained by shadows, becoming slowed 1 for one round.
annotation.prerequisites: Target must have succeeded on its saving throw against the spell.

annotation.summary: Eldritch Bond is a focus spell that requires two actions to cast and represents forming or invoking a supernatural connection.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to a focus pool or class feature granting Eldritch Bond

annotation.summary: A special ability or spell with uncommon rarity that involves concentrating mystical energy to manipulate or transform through polymorphic magic.
annotation.action_economy: Requires focus and concentration, likely a single action or sustained activity.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or polymorph abilities; ability to concentrate and focus.

annotation.summary: A high-level focus spell that uses two actions to create a web of restorative energy, likely healing or protecting allies through shared vitality.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Focus Spells of level 8 or higher; class or tradition that grants Vitality Web.

annotation.summary: A special ability or feature marked as uncommon that requires concentration and the use of focus, associated with mystic or magical vitality.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus or concentrate action, depending on system rules.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to mystic or vitality-based focus abilities; GM approval due to uncommon rarity.

annotation.summary: Creates a temporary network of vital energy linking bonded allies, granting them fast healing and temporary hit points when the spell is cast and sustained.
annotation.action_economy: Cast a Spell; Sustain a Spell each round to refresh temporary hit points
annotation.prerequisites: Must have a bond or network feature that connects multiple targets

annotation.summary: A rare mystical focus ability related to transformation or shapechanging magic.
Witchwarpers possess magical abilities that allow them to manipulate fate, time, and reality through their spellcasting.
annotation.action_economy: Varies by spell; typically requires a standard action to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must have levels in the Witchwarper class or equivalent spellcasting ability.

annotation.summary: Warp Probability is a reaction spell or ability that requires 1 Focus Point to activate.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least 1 Focus Point available.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with uncommon rarity that involves concentrating to anchor reality and manipulate fortune.
annotation.prerequisites: must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: Alternate Outcome is a reaction ability that requires Focus level 4. It likely allows a character to influence or change the result of an event or roll after it occurs.
annotation.prerequisites: Focus 4

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with the uncommon rarity that anchors a target and imposes misfortune, requiring concentration to maintain.
annotation.prerequisites: Witchwarper class; access to focus spells

annotation.summary: Quantum Analysis is a 6th-level focus ability that can be activated with one action, likely involving advanced perception or data interpretation using quantum principles.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to focus spells of at least 6th level; class or feature granting Quantum Analysis.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell or ability with uncommon rarity that involves mental and fortune effects, requiring concentration to activate and likely provides anchoring or stabilizing benefits.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a concentrate action, typically a single action to cast or activate.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells or class features that grant this ability.

annotation.summary: The spell allows the caster to perceive probabilistic outcomes, negating circumstance bonuses to AC from cover for targeted creatures. The caster also ignores circumstance penalties and flat checks from concealment or cover, and can target creatures within the spell's range even without line of sight.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast this spell; targets must be within the spell's quantum field

annotation.summary: After casting the spell, the first attack roll made against a creature within the quantum field during the spell's duration is rolled twice, taking the better result.
annotation.action_economy: None specified; effect triggers automatically after casting when conditions are met.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have cast the 'quantum analysis' spell and target a creature within its quantum field.

annotation.summary: Warp Terrain is a focus spell that alters the landscape or ground conditions within a specified area, typically to hinder movement or create tactical advantages.
annotation.prerequisites: Focus Spell; access to the Warp Terrain ability or tradition that grants it

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with the uncommon and anchoring traits that requires concentration to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: The ability allows the user to create terrain features from another reality within their quantum field, lasting until the field ends, the effect is recast, or the user dismisses it.
annotation.action_economy: Cast spell (duration tied to quantum field activity)
prerequisites: Ability to maintain a quantum field
Access to the warp terrain spell

annotation.summary: The ability removes difficult terrain within the user's quantum field, returning it to normal terrain unless the terrain difficulty is caused by specific creature effects. Magical or spell-based terrain requires a successful counteract attempt to suppress.
annotation.prerequisites: ability to generate or control a quantum field

annotation.summary: Warp World is a 4th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast. It likely manipulates reality or the environment in a dramatic or chaotic way, consistent with its name.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to the Warp World focus spell, typically through a class or feat that grants focus spells.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper-specific ability or spell with the uncommon rarity that requires focus and concentration, involving a manipulative action to anchor or stabilize magical effects.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a concentrate and manipulate action, typically using the character's focus.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to focus abilities.

annotation.summary: A quantum-based effect that targets creatures within your quantum field, creating a 10-foot burst area that challenges Fortitude defenses and lasts for 1 round.
A 6th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast, likely allowing the caster to assume or manifest multiple forms simultaneously or in parallel.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level focus spells or access to the class or tradition that grants this spell.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus ability with the uncommon and anchoring traits that requires concentration and manipulation to sustain for up to 1 minute.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration; sustained up to 1 minute
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to this focus ability

annotation.summary: The spell creates two simultaneous versions of the caster, each able to move and take one action. Both share the same bonuses, penalties, and damage pool. Attacks from both count toward the same multiple attack penalty. Area or shared effects apply only once, using the worse saving throw result. When the spell ends, one version remains and the other vanishes; the spell ends early if the caster reaches 0 HP.
annotation.action_economy: Each form Strides and takes one action upon casting; the spell requires a Sustain action each round to maintain.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the spell; must have actions available to Sustain each round.

annotation.summary: Warp Presence is a reaction ability that requires 1 Focus point to activate.
annotation.prerequisites: Must have at least 1 Focus point available.

annotation.summary: An uncommon witchwarper focus ability that requires concentration to maintain an anchoring effect.
annotation.prerequisites: must be a witchwarper with access to focus abilities

annotation.summary: This ability activates when an enemy chooses you as the target of a Strike or a spell attack.
annotation.prerequisites: An enemy must target you with a Strike or spell attack.

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with the uncommon rarity that requires concentration to maintain its effects.
annotation.action_economy: requires concentration; typically a focus spell action
annotation.prerequisites: must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: Reality Wipe is a 6th-level focus spell that requires two actions to cast. Its effects are not described in the provided text.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast 6th-level focus spells

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with the uncommon and anchoring traits that requires concentration to cast.
annotation.prerequisites: must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: The ability clears all data within the user's quantum field, erasing written and digital information as if affected by a delete effect, and attempts to counteract spells within the field similar to dispel magic, but only for the portion inside the field.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (depends on ability activation; likely 2 or 3 actions)
prerequisites: Access to a quantum field or similar ability

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus spell with the uncommon rarity that requires concentration to cast and has an anchoring effect.
annotation.action_economy: requires concentration (likely 1 or more actions depending on system)
annotation.prerequisites: must be a Witchwarper with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: A focus spell named Accelerate that requires two actions to cast and is available at focus level 4.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to focus spells of level 4 or higher

annotation.summary: A Witchwarper focus ability with the uncommon rarity that involves concentrating and manipulating magical or dimensional energies.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a focus action with the concentrate and manipulate traits.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a Witchwarper with access to focus abilities.

annotation.summary: A witchwarper ability with several traits indicating it is uncommon, requires focus and concentration, involves manipulation, and can incapacitate targets.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper to use this ability

annotation.summary: Quantum Negation is a high-level focus ability that requires two actions to activate and uses a focus point of level 10. The exact effects are not described in the provided text.
annotation.prerequisites: Focus level 10

annotation.summary: A witchwarper focus ability with uncommon rarity that involves mental concentration and death-related effects, likely used to anchor or stabilize energies or entities.
annotation.action_economy: Requires a concentrate action, typically performed as part of casting or maintaining a focus ability.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a witchwarper with access to focus abilities.

annotation.summary: A spell that forces a creature to confront a reality where it never existed, potentially erasing it from existence if reduced to 0 HP and of level 16 or lower. The target becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute after being affected.
annotation.prerequisites: Able to cast high-level illusion or reality-altering spells

annotation.summary: A powerful magical effect that can erase a creature from existence unless it is of 17th level or higher, in which case it simply dies upon being reduced to 0 Hit Points. The target makes a basic Will saving throw, and the spell's damage lacks a specific damage type. Only divine intervention, a wish ritual, or similar magic can counteract it.
annotation.action_economy: Varies depending on casting method (likely 2 or 3 actions typical for spells)
annotation.prerequisites: Access to high-level magic or divine intervention; target must be affected by the spell

annotation.summary: Clerics and certain followers can receive domain spells granted by their deities, and some deities in Starfinder are linked to the technology domain.
annotation.prerequisites: Character must be a cleric or devotee of a deity that grants domain spells.

annotation.summary: Tech Intuition is a focus-based reaction ability that likely allows a character to use their understanding of technology to respond quickly to a situation.
annotation.prerequisites: Focus 1

annotation.summary: A cleric-focused ability or spell with uncommon rarity that requires concentration and uses divine focus to grant a beneficial fortune effect.
annotation.action_economy: requires concentration (likely a single action or focus action)
annotation.prerequisites: must be a cleric with access to focus spells

annotation.summary: By concentrating on a technological item, the character gains insight into its purpose and operation, rolling the relevant check twice and taking the higher result.
annotation.action_economy: unspecified (focus or reaction depending on context)
annotation.prerequisites: must be interacting with or examining a technological item

annotation.summary: A 4th-level focus spell that allows the caster to communicate or interface with technological entities or systems.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast focus spells; access to a technological or divine tradition that grants this spell.

annotation.summary: This entry describes a cleric ability or focus spell that is uncommon and involves concentration and manipulation components.
annotation.action_economy: Requires concentration and manipulation actions, likely a focus spell action.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be a cleric with access to focus spells.

annotation.summary: Rituals are special spells accessible to all characters, requiring extended casting time but offering stronger effects than standard spells.
annotation.action_economy: Takes significantly longer than a normal spell to cast
annotation.prerequisites: None; any character can perform a ritual

annotation.summary: Describes the requirements and responsibilities of a primary caster when leading a ritual, including level and proficiency limitations, and the need to perform the primary skill check that defines the ritual's tradition.
annotation.action_economy: Out-of-combat activity; no specific action cost defined.
annotation.prerequisites: Must know the ritual; ritual's spell rank ≤ half your level (rounded up); required proficiency rank in the ritual's primary skill.

annotation.summary: Rituals are special spells that do not use spell slots and take significant time to perform, typically as a downtime activity. They can be heightened up to half the caster’s level and require continuous participation, often over multiple days, with at least one hour of casting time. Multiday rituals allow casters to rest in shifts while maintaining the ritual’s continuity.
annotation.action_economy: Downtime activity; requires at least 1 hour, often multiple days with 8-hour casting periods per day.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform rituals; sufficient uninterrupted time; participation from all casters during casting periods.

annotation.summary: A list of ranked ritual spells from a tabletop role-playing game, showing their relative power levels and thematic variety, ranging from object animation and consecration to weather control and planar manipulation.
annotation.action_economy: Rituals typically require extended casting time, often minutes or hours, rather than standard combat actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Caster must possess ritual casting ability and meet the minimum rank or level requirement for each listed ritual.

annotation.summary: Rituals are separate from normal spellcasting limits and do not count toward a character’s spell repertoire. They are typically uncommon, and finding someone to perform or teach one may require effort and persuasion.
annotation.action_economy: None specified; learning or performing a ritual is treated as a special activity outside normal actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Must locate a willing teacher or source for the ritual, which may be uncommon or restricted.

annotation.summary: The Cost entry of a ritual specifies the valuable components required to perform it. If no components are needed, no Cost entry appears. The listed cost is consumed when the primary skill check is made and is typically calculated as a base cost multiplied by the target’s level or spell rank. If the target’s level is below 1, use 1 instead. Heightened versions may adjust the multiplier. Rituals that create permanent creatures use costs based on the creature’s level, as detailed in the Creature Creations Ritual Table.
annotation.action_economy: Consumed during the primary skill check of the ritual; no separate action cost beyond the ritual casting process.
annotation.prerequisites: Knowledge of the ritual and access to the required valuable components as listed in the Cost entry.

annotation.summary: Rituals may require secondary casters who assist the primary caster. These assistants do not need spellcasting ability, level requirements, or skill proficiencies. The ritual’s description specifies how many secondary casters are needed if any.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this describes setup requirements rather than actions during play.
annotation.prerequisites: Presence of the specified number of secondary casters as listed in the ritual’s Secondary Casters entry.

annotation.summary: At the end of the ritual, the performer makes the specified primary skill check to determine success or failure. The DC is typically very hard for a level equal to twice the ritual’s spell rank. External modifiers like fortune, misfortune, or temporary bonuses and penalties cannot affect this check.
annotation.prerequisites: Must be performing a ritual and reach its culmination phase to make the primary skill check.

annotation.summary: The GM has authority to modify ritual difficulty and requirements based on context, such as environmental or situational factors that could make a ritual easier or harder.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this rule concerns GM adjudication rather than player actions.
annotation.prerequisites: None; applies whenever the GM is determining or modifying ritual conditions.

annotation.summary: A table listing the escalating credit costs required to perform creature-related rituals at various levels or ritual ranks.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; this section only provides cost information.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires access to the appropriate ritual rank and sufficient credits for the listed cost.

annotation.summary: Rituals may include secondary checks with a DC based on twice the ritual's spell rank. Each check must be made by a different secondary caster, and any extra participants do not make checks.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; occurs during ritual casting rather than standard combat actions.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires multiple casters, with each secondary caster performing one unique check.

annotation.summary: Secondary casters make their checks before the primary caster. Regardless of success or failure, the ritual continues, and their results modify the outcome of the primary check.
annotation.action_economy: Secondary checks occur prior to the primary check within the same ritual sequence.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires multiple participants: at least one primary caster and one or more secondary casters.

annotation.summary: The outcome of a ritual is determined by the primary skill check result. If the ritual requires a saving throw, use your spell DC for your magical tradition, or calculate it as 12 plus your level and your highest mental ability modifier if you lack a spell DC.
annotation.action_economy: Not applicable; this describes a calculation rule rather than an action.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform a ritual; knowledge of your level and mental ability modifiers.

annotation.summary: A ritual that takes one full day to cast, requiring rare oils as material components and one additional secondary caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires rare oils and one secondary caster

annotation.summary: Transforms a target into an animated object whose level and type correspond to the original object's characteristics, as determined by the Creature Creation Rituals table.
annotation.prerequisites: Access to Creature Creation Rituals and an eligible target object

annotation.summary: A ritual that takes one full day to cast, requiring rare incense and offerings valued at 200 credits per level of the target. It also needs one secondary caster, who must be the target of the ritual.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires one secondary caster who is the ritual's target and material components worth 200 credits × target's level

annotation.summary: A ritual to help a genuinely penitent creature atone for its misdeeds, using Nature or Religion depending on the creature's nature. If the target is not truly penitent, the ritual automatically fails critically.
annotation.action_economy: Ritual (time determined by GM or ritual rules)
annotation.prerequisites: A truly penitent creature seeking atonement; caster must use Nature if the target is naturally inclined, otherwise Religion.

annotation.summary: If the atonement ritual fails, the creature must continue efforts to make amends. Future attempts to atone for the same misdeeds are cheaper and easier to perform.
annotation.prerequisites: Previous failed atonement ritual for the same misdeeds

annotation.summary: This ritual requires one full day to cast, consumes herbs worth one-fifth the listed value for Creature Creation rituals, and needs three secondary casters to assist.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires herbs as material components and three secondary casters

annotation.summary: A ritual that takes one day to perform, requiring specific materials and multiple participants. The primary caster must make a master-level Computers check, while secondary casters contribute with Lore, Society, or Survival checks.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires 3 secondary casters and materials worth one-fifth the value listed under Creature Creation Rituals; primary caster must have master proficiency in Computers.

annotation.summary: A ritual spell that requires one full day to cast, specific costly ingredients based on spell rank and target level, and three additional secondary casters.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires three secondary casters and warding circle ingredients worth 20 credits × spell rank × target's level.

annotation.summary: Summons an extraplanar creature whose level is up to twice the ritual's rank, allowing the caster to negotiate a service in return for compensation.
annotation.action_economy: ritual casting time (varies by ritual rules)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform the binding circle ritual

annotation.summary: On a critical success, the summoned extraplanar creature can be compelled to remain for up to one day, giving the summoner leverage for negotiation.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to summon or call an extraplanar creature

annotation.summary: The ritual reduces farm crop yields, but if cast in an area influenced by the Plant Growth effect, it instead attempts to counteract that effect rather than causing its normal harm.
annotation.action_economy: ritual casting time (varies by system, typically several minutes)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the Blight ritual; area must contain crops or vegetation

annotation.summary: A ritual spell that requires one hour to cast, consumes rare candles and incense worth 500 credits, and involves one secondary caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires rare candles and incense worth 500 credits and one secondary caster

annotation.summary: The caster summons a named spirit from the afterlife using a personal connection. The spirit may resist with a Will save, and if it critically succeeds, a trickster spirit appears instead. The caster can ask the spirit one question per minute, though the spirit may refuse to answer. If the target spirit is undead or otherwise not in the afterlife, only failure effects apply.
annotation.action_economy: Varies (likely a ritual or extended casting time, with one question per minute during duration)
annotation.prerequisites: Must know the spirit's name and possess a personal connection item (possession, garment, or body part)

annotation.summary: A ritual spell that requires one full day to cast, consumes rare incense worth 3,000 credits, and needs two additional participants.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires rare incense worth 3,000 credits and two secondary casters.

annotation.summary: This ritual allows the caster to draw upon the collective memories and lore of mortals to gain insight into an important person, place, or thing. The presence of the subject or the caster’s familiarity with it modifies the success of the primary skill check.
annotation.action_economy: Ritual (time and components determined by the specific system’s ritual rules)
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to perform rituals and a subject of significance (person, place, or thing)

annotation.summary: On a critical success, the ritual grants the user one hour of mostly coherent memory recall, allowing them to sort and emphasize specific recollections.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; effect occurs after ritual completion
annotation.prerequisites: Completion of the ritual and achieving a critical success

annotation.summary: Upon a successful ritual completion, the character gains partial and possibly conflicting information that aids further investigation for one hour.
annotation.prerequisites: Successful completion of the ritual

annotation.summary: A ritual spell that requires one full day to cast, consumes rare incense worth 1,500 credits, and involves one additional secondary caster.
annotation.prerequisites: Requires rare incense worth 1,500 credits and one secondary caster.

annotation.summary: A ritual spell that takes three days to cast, requires rare incense and offerings worth 200 credits per spell rank, and needs two additional casters who share the caster's religion.
annotation.prerequisites: Two secondary casters who are worshippers of the same religion; material components worth 200 credits × spell rank

annotation.summary: At 7th rank, the consecrated area gains the effects of the planar seal spell, except it does not block teleportation by the caster’s deity’s worshippers. The material cost increases proportionally to the spell rank.
annotation.action_economy: Not specified; follows the base consecrate spell’s casting time.
annotation.prerequisites: Ability to cast the consecrate spell heightened to 7th rank.
